cap-shape.info: The shape of the head of the mushroom.

cap-surface.info: The texture on the head of the mushroom.

gill-attachment.info: How the gills, underneath the cap, are attached to the stalk.

gill-spacing.info: How the gills, underneath the cap, are spaced.

stalk-shape.info: The shape of the stalk, located below the head.

stalk-root.info: The shape of the root at the bottom of the stalk

stalk-surface-above-ring.info: The texture on the stalk above the ring, the ring is location about 2/3 up the stalk usually.

stalk-surface-below-ring.info: The texture on the stalk below the ring, the ring is location about 2/3 up the stalk usually.

veil-type.info: Tissue 'veil' like structure on the mushroom. A universal veil covers the entire cap and extends down. A partial veil does not cover the entire cap, and is more present on the underside of the cap and stem.

ring-number.info: a ring of tissue around the stalk. The ring is what remains of the veil.

ring-type.info: Shape of the ring, if present, around the stalk.

spore-print-color.info: The spore print is the powdery deposit obtained by allowing spores of a fungal fruit body to fall onto a surface underneath, typically obtained by cutting off the cap and placing it gill side down on paper over night.
